page.title: 07A TEACHER'S DAY
page.content: The children interviewed one of the teachers, Mr.B., about a typical day. This is what he said: I get up at about 7 o'clock, along with the rest of my family. Breakfast is usually cereals and toast. I live about 25 miles from school in Stafford and so I have to leave home by 8.00am to drive to school in my car. I arrive at school by 8.40 so that I can be ready for when children arrive at 8.50. Lessons begin at 9.00 and basic work like Maths and English take up most of the morning, with PE or a TV programme as well. I often have my dinner with the children. I like chatting to them. Afternoons are taken up with projects, art and craft,etc. When the children go home at 3.30, I often spend some time in school preparing for the next day, then do 2 or 3 hours more at home.
